varieties.name: Cherry Belle
varieties.description: Cherry Belle Radish is a classic radish variety known for its vibrant red color and crisp, mild flavor. With a compact growth habit, it produces round roots that are perfect for salads, snacking, or pickling. This annual radish variety is well-suited for small gardens and container gardening.
varieties.fun_fact: Radishes are one of the fastest-growing vegetables and can be ready for harvest in as little as three weeks from planting.
varieties.planting_tip: For successful cultivation of Cherry Belle Radish, direct sow seeds in well-draining soil with moderate fertility. Plant in a sunny location for optimal growth. Keep the soil consistently moist to encourage rapid root development. Radishes are best harvested when they are young and tender. Consider successive plantings for a continuous harvest throughout the growing season.

varieties.name: Detroit Dark Red
varieties.description: Detroit Dark Red Beet is a popular beet variety known for its deep red color, sweet flavor, and versatility in culinary applications. With an upright growth habit, it produces round, globe-shaped roots that are excellent for salads, roasting, or pickling. This annual beet variety is well-suited for small gardens and container gardening.
varieties.fun_fact: Beets are not only valued for their roots but also for their nutritious and edible leaves, known as beet greens. Beet greens can be cooked or eaten raw in salads.
varieties.planting_tip: For successful cultivation of Detroit Dark Red Beet, directly sow seeds in well-draining soil with moderate fertility. Plant in a sunny to partially shaded location for optimal growth. Keep the soil consistently moist to encourage tender root development. Harvest beets when they reach the desired size, typically around 2-3 inches in diameter. Beet greens can also be harvested for culinary use.
